result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew D Smith Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew D Smith Jr in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Andrew D Smith Jr.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Defense is requesting an adjournment, defendant is pursuing treatment. State makes notice that offer will be revoked if not accepted at next court date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew D Smith Jr in court.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Andrew D Smith Jr.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received an offer from the State. Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew D Smith in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.2.22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered SCRAM bracelet to monitor the Defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Andrew D Smith in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Andrew D Smith in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew D Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
